edge: The Earth Space Defense (ESD) is a global defense advanced research program founded by the United Nations after the War of 1996 to reverse-engineer alien technology and serve as Earth's alert system against extraterrestrial threats.
The ESD reverse-engineers alien technology, implying that the aliens' technology is within its scope of study and utilization.
The ESD serves as Earth's alert system against extraterrestrial threats, indicating that it is equipped to handle and respond to potential invasions from outer space.
The ESD has established Area 51 as its headquarters, further elaborating on the extent of its operations and infrastructure.
The ESD has set up bases on the Moon, indicating its presence and activities in our solar system's neighboring body.
The ESD has also set up bases on Mars, underscoring its ambitiousness and scope of operations in our solar system.
The ESD has fortified against future invasions by setting up bases on Rhea, highlighting the importance of this moon of Saturn in its defense strategy.
The ESD has orbital defense satellites above Earth, reflecting its sophisticated technological capabilities and proactive approach to space-based security.
The ESD was founded twenty years after the War of 1996, hinting at a possible connection between the two events.
Levinson, Marceaux, and Dikembe Umbutu discover that the aliens were drilling before sending a distress signal to their homeworld prior to their defeat while exploring a landed alien saucer.

node_2: levinson, dr. brackish okun, umbutu, and u.s. president thomas whitmore
edge: Levinson, Dr. Brackish Okun, Umbutu, and U.S. President Thomas Whitmore have visions of an unidentified spherical object due to their telepathic link with the aliens' collective consciousness.
An unidentified spherical ship emerges from a wormhole near Earth's Moon, and despite objections from Levinson, it is destroyed on the orders of the Security Council.
American pilots Jake Morrison and Charlie Miller defy orders and collect Levinson, Marceaux, Umbutu, and U.S. President Thomas Whitmore.
Levinson meets with warlord Dikembe Umbutu and Dr. Catherine Marceaux in the African state RÃ©publique Nationale d'Umbutu.
defying orders, American pilots Jake Morrison and Charlie Miller then collect Levinson, Marceaux, Umbutu, and U.S. federal controller Floyd Rosenberg on a space tug.
Heads for the wreckage in the Van de Graaff crater, where they recover a large container.
An alien mothership over 3,000 kilometers in diameter, suddenly appears, responding to the distress call,

and proceeds to destroy much of Earth's planetary defense systems before landing over the North Atlantic Ocean where it starts to drill down toward Earth's molten core for fuel that will destroy the planet in the process.

node_2: aliens held in captivity at area 51's prison facility
edge: They learn that the aliens exist in a hivemind and that one of their colossal Queens is commanding the invasion.
Realizing that they had killed a supervising Queen above Earth during the first invasion, Levinson hypothesizes that if they kill this one, her forces will cease drilling and go dormant.
An ESD aerial fleet led by Captain Dylan Hiller stages a counterattack, but they are ambushed within the mothership,

node_2: esd lieutenant and chinese pilot rain lao
edge: leaving only a few survivors including Dylan, Jake, Charlie, and fellow ESD lieutenant and Chinese pilot Rain Lao.
Okun opens the rescued container and releases a giant white sphere of virtual intelligence,
Rain Lao is an ESD pilot.
The Harvesters are targeting refugees from other worlds, including Rain Lao's planet.
The virtual intelligence reveals that its mission is to evacuate survivors, including those targeted by the Harvesters.
The Harvester Queen becomes aware of the location of the virtual intelligence.
All surviving ESD pilots escape by hijacking enemy craft.
The Harvester Queen tries to extract information about the refugee planet from Rain Lao.
Whitmore volunteers to lead a suicide mission to lure the Harvester Queen's ship into a trap.
During the engagement, Patricia deactivates the Harvester Queen's shield with a critical hit.

The Queen, leader of the Harvesters, has ordered to kill the sphere before it falls into human hands as it contains crucial information for their resistance. Without the Queen's guidance, all remaining alien fighters become inactive.
The Mothership stops drilling and retreats to space as the Harvesters' leader, the Queen, is gone.
Okun reveals that the sphere has asked humanity to lead her resistance in preparation for a counterattack on the Harvesters' homeworld.
